patterns: which diseases do you know about?
on which diseases you were trained?
responses: Acne,Alcoholic hepatitis,Allergy,Arthritis,Benign Paroxymsal Positional Vertigo,Bronchial Asthma,COVID-19,Cervical spondylosis,Chicken pox,Chronic cholestasis,Common Cold,Dengue,Diabetes,Dimorphic hemmorhoids(piles),Drug Reaction,Fungal infection,GERD,Gastroenteritis,Heart attack,Hepatitis A,Hepatitis B,Hepatitis C,Hepatitis D,Hepatitis E,Hypertension,Hyperthyroidism,Hypoglycemia,Hypothyroidism,Impetigo,Jaundice,Malaria,Migraine,Osteoarthristis,Paralysis (brain hemorrhage),Peptic ulcer disease,Pneumonia,Psoriasis,Tuberculosis,Typhoid,Urinary tract infection,Varicose veins,fever

Common Cold. Treatment : Most people recover on their own within two weeks. Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Analgesic, Antihistamine, Cough medicine and Decongestant and home remedies can help control symptoms.

Fever. Treatment : Take paracetamol or ibuprofen in appropriate doses to help bring your temperature down.Drink plenty of fluids, particularly water.Avoid alcohol, tea and coffee as these drinks can cause slight dehydration.Avoid taking cold baths or showers.
Fungal infection. Treatment : Treatments include antifungal medication like clotrimazole,econazole,miconazole,terbinafine,fluconazole.
Allergy. Treatment : Treatments vary and can include antihistamines like loratadine,cetirizine,fexofenadine and avoiding allergens.
GERD. Treatment : Medication like Antacid, Proton-pump inhibitor and Antidiarrhoeal are usually temporary. Stronger medication may be required.

Chronic cholestasis. Treatment : Cholestasis often does not respond to medical therapy of any sort. Some reports indicate success in children with chronic cholestatic diseases with the use of ursodeoxycholic acid (20-30 mg/kg/d), which acts to increase bile formation and antagonizes the effect of hydrophobic bile acids on biological membranes.

Drug Reaction. Treatment : Antihistamines to relieve mild symptoms such as rash, hives, and itching.Bronchodilators such as albuterol to reduce asthma-like symptoms (moderate wheezing or cough).Corticosteroids applied to the skin, given by mouth, or given through a vein (intravenously).Epinephrine by injection to treat anaphylaxis.

Peptic ulcer disease. Treatment : Treatment usually includes medication to decrease stomach acid production. If it is caused by bacteria, antibiotics may be required.Proton pump inhibitors (PPI): Proton pump inhibitors reduce acid and allow the ulcer to heal. PPIs include Prilosec®, Prevacid®, Aciphex®, Protonix®, and Nexium®.

Diabetes. Treatment : Controlling blood sugar through diet, oral medication or insulin is the main treatment. Regular screening for complications is also required.Controlling blood sugar (glucose) levels is the major goal of diabetes treatment, in order to prevent complications of the disease. Type 1 diabetes is managed with insulin as well as dietary changes and exercise. Type 2 diabetes may be managed with non-insulin medications, insulin, weight reduction, or dietary changes.
Gastroenteritis. Treatment : Avoiding contaminated food and water and washing hands can often help prevent infection. Rest and rehydration are the mainstays of treatment.

Bronchial Asthma. Treatment: Asthma can usually be managed with rescue inhalers to treat symptoms (salbutamol) and controller inhalers that prevent symptoms (steroids). Severe cases may require longer-acting inhalers that keep the airways open (formoterol, salmeterol, tiotropium), as well as inhalant steroids.
Hypertension. Treatment : Eating a healthier diet with less salt, exercising regularly and taking medication can help lower blood pressure.

Migraine. Treatment : Preventive and pain-relieving medication like Antipsychotic, Analgesic, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Stimulant, Nerve pain medication, Triptan, Neurotoxin and Dietary supplement can help manage migraine headaches.

Cervical spondylosis. Treatment : Treatments include medication like Analgesic, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Muscle relaxant, Steroid, Narcotic and Local anesthetic, corticosteroid injections, physiotherapy and sometimes surgery.

Paralysis (brain hemorrhage). Treatment : Treatment within the first three hours of the onset of symptoms generally results in a better outcome. Surgery can relieve pressure on your brain and repair torn arteries. Certain medications can help manage symptoms, such as painkillers to ease severe headaches. Drugs may be necessary to control blood pressure.
COVID-19. Treatment: There are no specific vaccines or medicines for COVID-19.Self-care is the best prevention.

Jaundice. Treatment : jaundice may be treated by boosting the amount of iron in the blood by either taking iron supplements or eating more iron-rich foods.Hepatitis-induced jaundice requires antiviral or steroid medications.Doctors can treat obstruction-induced jaundice by surgically removing the obstruction.

Malaria. Treatment : Treated with prescription drugs like Combination of atovaquone and proguanil (Malarone),Quinine sulfate (Qualaquin) with doxycycline (Vibramycin, Monodox, others),Mefloquine,Primaquine phosphate to kill the parasite.

Chicken pox. Treatment : A cool bath with added baking soda, aluminum acetate (Domeboro, others), uncooked oatmeal or colloidal oatmeal — a finely ground oatmeal that is made for soaking. Calamine lotion dabbed on the spots. A soft, bland diet if chickenpox sores develop in the mouth.
Dengue. Treatment : Treatment includes fluids and pain relievers like Analgesic. Severe cases require hospital care.
Typhoid. Treatment : Treatment includes antibiotics,penicillin and fluids.
Hepatitis A. Treatment : The condition clears up on its own in one or two months. Rest and adequate hydration can help.

Hepatitis B. Treatment : The condition often clears up on its own. Chronic cases require medication like entecavir (Baraclude), tenofovir (Viread), lamivudine (Epivir), adefovir (Hepsera) and telbivudine (Tyzeka) — can help fight the virus and slow its ability to damage your liver and possibly a liver transplant.

Hepatitis C. Treatment : Treated using direct acting antiviral (DAA) tablets. DAA tablets are the safest and most effective medicines for treating hepatitis C. They're highly effective at clearing the infection in more than 90% of people.

Hepatitis D. Treatment : There is currently no cure for hepatitis D, but treatment can help people manage the condition. For people with chronic hepatitis D, a doctor will often prescribe a medicine called pegylated interferon-alpha, which reduces the risk of the condition worsening. People will usually take this for at least 48 weeks.

Hepatitis E. Treatment : Hepatitis E usually resolves on its own within four to six weeks. Treatment focuses on supportive care, rehydration and rest. Most important is the avoidance of unnecessary medications. Acetaminophen/Paracetamol and medication against vomiting should not be given.
Alcoholic hepatitis. Treatment : Treatment involves hydration, nutritional care and stopping alcohol use. Steroid drugs can help reduce liver inflammation.

Tuberculosis. Treatment : Treating TB takes much longer than treating other types of bacterial infections. For active tuberculosis, you must take antibiotics for at least six to nine months. The exact drugs and length of treatment depend on your age, overall health, possible drug resistance and the infection's location in the body.

Pneumonia. Treatment : Mild pneumonia can usually be treated at home with rest, antibiotics and by drinking plenty of fluids. More severe cases may need hospital treatment. Unless a healthcare professional tells you otherwise, you should always finish taking a prescribed course of antibiotics, even if you feel better.

Dimorphic hemmorhoids(piles). Treatment : Hemorrhoids are typically diagnosed by physical examination.A visual examination of the anus and surrounding area may diagnose external or prolapsed hemorrhoids.Healthcare professional is must.

Heart attack. Treatment : Treatment ranges from lifestyle changes and cardiac rehabilitation to medication like Aspirin,Thrombolytics,Antiplatelet agentsand Other blood-thinning medications, stents and bypass surgery.
Varicose veins. Treatment : Treatment involves compression stockings, exercise or procedures to close or remove the veins using surgery.

Hypothyroidism. Treatment : Standard treatment for hypothyroidism involves daily use of the synthetic thyroid hormone levothyroxine (Levo-T, Synthroid, others). This oral medication restores adequate hormone levels, reversing the signs and symptoms of hypothyroidism.
Hyperthyroidism

Hypoglycemia. Treatment : Consuming high-sugar foods or drinks, such as orange juice or regular fizzy drinks, can treat this condition. Alternatively, medication can be used to raise blood sugar levels. It's also important that a doctor identifies and treats the underlying cause.

Osteoarthristis. Treatment : Medication like Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Analgesic, Dietary supplement and Narcotic, physiotherapy and sometimes surgery can help reduce pain and maintain joint movement.

Arthritis. Treatment : Medication like Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Steroid, Analgesic, Narcotic and Immunosuppressive drug, physiotherapy or sometimes surgery helps reduce symptoms and improve quality of life.

Benign Paroxymsal Positional Vertigo. Treatment : Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo may go away on its own within a few weeks or months. But, to help relieve BPPV sooner, your doctor, audiologist or physical therapist may treat you with a series of movements known as the canalith repositioning procedure.
Acne. Treatment : Treatments include over-the-counter creams and cleanser, as well as prescription antibiotics like Anti-inflammatory, Vitamin A derivative, Antibiotics and Topical antiseptic.
Urinary tract infection. Treatment : Common treatment is with antibiotics like Trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole (Bactrim, Septra, others),Fosfomycin (Monurol),Nitrofurantoin (Macrodantin, Macrobid).
Psoriasis. Treatment : Treatment aims to remove scales and stop skin cells from growing so quickly. Topical ointments, light therapy and medication can offer relief.

Impetigo. Treatment : Impetigo typically is treated with an antibiotic ointment or cream that you apply directly to the sores. You may need to first soak the affected area in warm water or use wet compresses to help remove the scabs so the antibiotic can penetrate the skin.
